past. We must not make those decisions which
result in the poor and disadvantaged getting
"stuck" with a block of materials someone
"thought" would be helpful for them to be
exposed to.
We must work to convince the poor that it is
worthwhile to invest a portion of their energy,
the energy they expend in the daily struggle for
survival, in the reconstruction of their values,
so that their lives can have greater meaning,
their efforts have deeper validity. No single
project or proposal has, as yet, touched these
values. So we may begin our task now, and say
that as of this date, we shall attack, confident,
as we are confident, that there is a way, a reason
to have hope that these things will come to pass.
